byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

abstract: United Nations may be moving to compensate and publicly apologize to Roma families in Kosovo who were held for years in camps built on toxic ground that leached lead and poisoned them; human rights panel, which investigated and found that UN peacekeeping mission in region failed to heed warnings about camps' health hazards, urges agency to do so.
lead_paragraph: A panel found that the United Nations compromised the lives and health of inhabitants of the camps, which were built on a toxic wasteland and had high levels of lead.

headline.main: Roma Poisoned at U.N. Camps in Kosovo May Get Apology and Compensation
